TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to us.
Can you please let us know the name of the customer?
To monitor the RDP exit point, please make sure to select "Remote Desktop Connection" inside the Policy Exit Points > Cloud Services/File Sharing.
Regarding VBox for now, the only way to block it in the mentioned scenarios is to block processes like "VirtualBox.exe" or disable the clipboard.
Please let us know after you've tested it and if we can close the ticket after that.

Have a nice day,
Best regards,
Alin Anca

Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
Hello,

The virtualisation would need to be present in the CAP policy exit points for Epp to be able to block it. If it si not present in the exit points it might not block it.

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000OWfS7:ref

Hello!

Thank you for the quick response.
So, I have not found any virtualization platform within the CAP policy exit points.
I was searching for VBox, VMware, Hyper-v and Oracle but nothing is in there.
So does it mean that the only way to control Virtual Platforms is or block the application or just install EPP client on virtual machines?


Best regards,

[cid:f01bab47-ed08-441d-a5e0-e4194a830df1]

Security Support Engineer

CoreWin<https://corewin.ua/en/> | Contacts<https://corewin.ua/contacts/>

The virtualisation would need to be present in the CAP policy exit points for Epp to be able to block it. If it si not present in the exit points it might not block it.
